definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]

sentences.english: Never clear off your desk by randomly throwing things in a drawer.
sentences.chinese: 不要爲了收拾整頓你的桌子而隨便把東西扔進抽斗裏。

sentences.english: He leaped down from the commode and seized his hat.
sentences.chinese: 他從抽斗櫃上跳下來，拿起他的帽子。

sentences.english: she came across some old photographs in a drawer.
sentences.chinese: 她在抽斗裏屋或者發明一些舊相片。

sentences.english: You may find yourself in a position where you want to smoke but do not have a pipe.
sentences.chinese: 您也許遇到過想抽斗而沒有菸斗的時候。

sentences.english: You should put the letter away, be careful not to lose it.
sentences.chinese: 把那封信放到我抽斗裏，小心別丟了。

definition: drawer/stackable cooking vessel/woven mat on a bed frame or chair/woven window screen
three-drawer desk (traditional Chinese piece of furniture)
